text:
Eddy Beugels (19 March 1944 – 12 January 2018) was a retired Dutch cyclist. He was born in Schinnen, the Netherlands.
Beugels won a silver medal in the team time trial at the 1966 UCI Road World Championships. He also won the Ronde van Noord-Holland (1966), Grand Prix de Wallonie (1968), Eschborn-Frankfurt City Loop, and one stage of the Olympia's Tour (1965).
During his career that spanned seven years between 1964 and 1970 he competed three times in the Tour de France, in 1968, 1969 and 1970.
